messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Conference? (and stuff)
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 4/12/03 1:02:44 AM, aisliin@yahoo.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 4/12/03 1:02:44 AM, aisliin@... writes:

<< For those
interested, remember my hubby had a near fatal car
accident last fall and broke himself up pretty good?
He's healing really well, getting stronger all the
time, with only occassional twinges from the broken
bones. >>

Thanks for letting us know.

Last week it crossed my mind and I was hesitant to ask.

Sandra

messages.subject: [AlwaysLearning] Conference? (and stuff)
messages.msgSnippet: ... Ooooo, where is the one on the West Coast?  Somehow I missed hearing the details of that.  Of course things have been kinda crazy round here.  For those
messages.messageBody:
>You REALLY might want to comsider one of the two
>conferences---one on the west coast and one on the
>east.
>Kelly

Ooooo, where is the one on the West Coast? Somehow I
missed hearing the details of that. Of course things
have been kinda crazy round here. For those
interested, remember my hubby had a near fatal car
accident last fall and broke himself up pretty good?
He's healing really well, getting stronger all the
time, with only occassional twinges from the broken
bones.

The bad news is that he got laid off from his job
about a month ago. He's working hard to find a new
job, but this damned war (as I like to call it) is not
condusive to hiring. Fortunately we spend less than
we make and live simply, so we are able to eke by on
what we had, his retirement savings cashout from his
job and our tax return. We're both looking for part
time work to keep us afloat before that money runs
dry, and if another job in his field does not present
itself before that time. On the plus side, the boys
and I are loving having him around all the time, and a
lot of projects are getting done around the house and
property.

Nanci K.
